meanings.definition: To defeat or outperform in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outplay her opponent in chess.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outplay their rivals in the soccer match.
meanings.sent3: The young boy tried to outplay his sister in a friendly game of cards.
meanings.sent4: His strategic moves allowed him to outplay his competitors in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his skills to outplay his audience's expectations.

meanings.definition: To surpass in skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: Despite his young age, he was able to outplay the experienced players.
meanings.sent2: Her dedication and practice helped her outplay her own previous records.
meanings.sent3: The clever inventor managed to outplay his own limitations.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity always outplays conventional norms.
meanings.sent5: His determination to learn continuously allowed him to outplay his peers.

meanings.sent1: The detective had to outplay the criminal's cunning tactics.
meanings.sent2: She used her quick thinking to outplay her opponents in the debate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to outplay the dog in a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to read people's intentions helped her outplay any deceitful schemes.
meanings.sent5: The clever fox always managed to outplay the hunters with his tricks.
